text: ant skin, especially on the face Hernias Short stature Delayed closure of the fontanelles Short fingers Characteristic facial appearance with puffy eyelids, blue sclerae (whites of the eyes), epicanthal folds, downslanting palpebral fissures (outside corners of the eyes that point downward) and micrognathia Rupture of the bladder or diaphragm Mild to severe joint hypermobility The Human Phenotype Ontology provides the following list of signs and symptoms for Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, dermatosparax
